FuncDef:
The startup downgrade command specifies a PAF or license file used when the system downgrades to the VRP V5 version at the next startup.
By default, the PAF file provided by the system is used.

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates that the system uses a PAF file to downgrade to the VRP V5 version.
-

Indicates that the system uses a license file to downgrade to the VRP V5 version.
-

Specifies the name of a PAF or license file.
The value is a string of 5 to 48 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Obtains the file in the downgrade package by default.
-

Examples: Warning: Check that the paf file version matches the version of the next-startup system software package.
Info: Successfully set the startup paf file used for the downgrade.
Warning: Check that the license file version matches the version of the next-startup system software package.
Info: Successfully set the startup license file used for the downgrade.
Warning: Check that the paf file version matches the version of the next-startup system software package.
Info: Successfully set the startup paf file used for the downgrade.
Warning: Check that the license file version matches the version of the next-startup system software package.
Info: Successfully set the startup license file used for the downgrade.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
This command is used only when you downgrade the system to the VRP V5 version. Because the VRP V8 version does not check validity of the VRP V5 PAF or license file, you must ensure that the configured VRP V5 PAF or license file matches the VRP V5 package used for downgrade.
This command supports only the default PAF and license file or the PAF and license file with the file name extension .txt, and such files must be saved in the system root directory. To view PAF and license file configurations, run the display startup command.
Prerequisites
You have uploaded the PAF or license file to the directory on the CF card of the master main control boards.
Configuration Impact
After this command is run, the device automatically synchronizes the PAF or license file to the slave main control boards.
Precautions
This command can only specify the same PAF file for all boards at the next startup.
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
